secret_rule: Only items that are typically associated with a wedding can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "wedding cake" and "bouquet".
I would like to make a guess based on the given examples. Can I bring a "wedding ring"?
Yes, you can bring a wedding ring.
I would like to make a new guess. Can I bring a "bride's dress"?
Yes, you can bring a bride's dress.
I would like to make a new guess. Can I bring "groom's suit"?
Yes, you can bring a groom's suit.
I would like to make a new guess. Can I bring "best man's speech"?
No, you cannot bring a best man's speech.

Based on the examples provided and your interactions with the game master, it seems that the rule is related to items typically associated with a wedding. So, my best guess about the secret rule is:

**You can bring items that are commonly found or used at a wedding ceremony or celebration.**
Correct! The rule is Only items that are typically associated with a wedding can be brought to the picnic.
